1.text: When therefore the LORD knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,

2.text: (Though Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples,)

3.text: He left Judaea, and departed again into Galilee.

4.text: And he must needs go through Samaria.

5.text: Then comes he to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.

6.text: Now Jacobâ€™s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with his journey, sat thus on the well: and it was about the sixth hour.

7.text: There comes a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus said to her, Give me to drink.

8.text: (For his disciples were gone away to the city to buy meat.)

9.text: Then said the woman of Samaria to him, How is it that you, being a Jew, ask drink of me, which am a woman of Samaria? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.

10.text: Jesus answered and said to her, If you knew the gift of God, and who it is that said to you, Give me to drink; you would have asked of him, and he would have given you living water.

11.text: The woman said to him, Sir, you have nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: from where then have you that living water?

12.text: Are you greater than our father Jacob, which gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his children, and his cattle?

13.text: Jesus answered and said to her, Whoever drinks of this water shall thirst again:

14.text: But whoever drinks of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life.

15.text: The woman said to him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come here to draw.

16.text: Jesus said to her, Go, call your husband, and come here.

17.text: The woman answered and said, I have no husband. Jesus said to her, You have well said, I have no husband:

18.text: For you have had five husbands; and he whom you now have is not your husband: in that said you truly.

19.text: The woman said to him, Sir, I perceive that you are a prophet.

20.text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and you say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.

21.text: Jesus said to her, Woman, believe me, the hour comes, when you shall neither in this mountain, nor yet at Jerusalem, worship the Father.

22.text: You worship you know not what: we know what we worship: for salvation is of the Jews.

23.text: But the hour comes, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth: for the Father seeks such to worship him.

24.text: God is a Spirit: and they that worship him must worship him in spirit and in truth.

25.text: The woman said to him, I know that Messias comes, which is called Christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things.

26.text: Jesus said to her, I that speak to you am he.

27.text: And on this came his disciples, and marveled that he talked with the woman: yet no man said, What seek you? or, Why talk you with her?

28.text: The woman then left her water pot, and went her way into the city, and said to the men,

29.text: Come, see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ?

30.text: Then they went out of the city, and came to him.

31.text: In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.

32.text: But he said to them, I have meat to eat that you know not of.

33.text: Therefore said the disciples one to another, Has any man brought him ought to eat?

34.text: Jesus said to them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to finish his work.

35.text: Say not you, There are yet four months, and then comes harvest? behold, I say to you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields; for they are white already to harvest.

36.text: And he that reaps receives wages, and gathers fruit to life eternal: that both he that sows and he that reaps may rejoice together.

37.text: And herein is that saying true, One sows, and another reaps.

38.text: I sent you to reap that where on you bestowed no labor: other men labored, and you are entered into their labors.

39.text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman, which testified, He told me all that ever I did.

40.text: So when the Samaritans were come to him, they sought him that he would tarry with them: and he stayed there two days.

41.text: And many more believed because of his own word;

42.text: And said to the woman, Now we believe, not because of your saying: for we have heard him ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the world.

43.text: Now after two days he departed there, and went into Galilee.

44.text: For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet has no honor in his own country.

45.text: Then when he was come into Galilee, the Galilaeans received him, having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went to the feast.

46.text: So Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.

47.text: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee, he went to him, and sought him that he would come down, and heal his son: for he was at the point of death.

48.text: Then said Jesus to him, Except you see signs and wonders, you will not believe.

49.text: The nobleman said to him, Sir, come down ere my child die.

50.text: Jesus said to him, Go your way; your son lives. And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken to him, and he went his way.

51.text: And as he was now going down, his servants met him, and told him, saying, Your son lives.

52.text: Then inquired he of them the hour when he began to amend. And they said to him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.

53.text: So the father knew that it was at the same hour, in the which Jesus said to him, Your son lives: and himself believed, and his whole house.

54.text: This is again the second miracle that Jesus did, when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee.
